website_summaries.verdict: Those desiring an easy-to-assemble tent for their hammock will like this accessory-filled model.
pros: Includes a rain fly and mosquito net
Comes with 2 stakes, 2 tent straps, and 2 carabiners
Drawstring bag allows for simple portability
cons: Mosquito net can be hard to assemble
Straps and stakes could be higher quality

customer_reviews.title: Great set for a casual hammock camper
customer_reviews.text: I used this hammock on a weeklong camping trip and it was everything I expected and more. I am a bigger guy 6’2” 250lbs and had no trouble sleeping in the hammock. It rained multiple times while on the trip and the rain fly kept everything dry. I did not care for the tree straps that come with it and replaced them with a different set and will be replacing the rain fly stakes due to personal preference but everything that comes with this set up is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Osborne

customer_reviews.title: A steal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday, its a decent sent, comes packaged well in a larger bag that holds 3 small bags, one for the hammock one for the trap and one for the straps. I took everything out of their bags, and while I would say the hammock and the rain fly are a slightly cheaper/unfamiliar material, I felt that for the price it was good construction and seems good enough. I am going on a 2 night backpacking trip next week and will update on my actual experience in the field, but overall I am happy with this product and think for the price it is excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised
customer_reviews.text: For the price-point I was originally hesitant of the quality. I have used this system 3 times now and the quality of the components have been more than I expected. Very comfortable! The first use was in a heavy rain storm 5 miles off any road. No water at all entered the hammock and worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin W

customer_reviews.title: Holy hammock - better suited for yards and parks
customer_reviews.text: Sadly it tore the first time we used it. The seams were messy, we saw there were tiny holes in the nylon and the mesh didn't seem very high quality. The first person to sit in (and tear) it was 5'10" and 145lb and in a fairly civilized park. If you do still buy this, leave plenty of slack on your mesh line, it seems we are not the only folks who had this issue. Had we only bought it to laze around the yard, I would have kept it but we got for wilderness camping and unfortunately this just won't cut it. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Tazi

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammock.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great value for what you get. Not sure on durability yet, but definitely comfortable and more spacious than my single-person hammock. Not really fond of the tree straps that came with it, I've got my python straps I'll be using instead. It's bulky if you keep it packed how it arrives, so I'm going to be using different compression sacks to take up less space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great return on investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hammock as a test product to see if i would invest in higher end gear. The most important thing I can say is I will never camp in a tent again! I took this on a week long trip with my best friend, it rained for 4 days, hailed for 2 of them. I never got wet! Everything felt really solid and well constructed. Truly a great bang for your buck! I would recommend doing a little research on how to sleep in a hammock, and how to setup properly! Really impressed!
customer_reviews.author: josh tracy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after second use. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after second use under normal to light use. Mosquito net ripped when my 12 year old son sat in it. It was more than 30 days after purchase so Amazon would not refund or replace. They gave me a number to call the supplier for a warranty claim, but the number goes to a recorded message with no option to speak to a person unless you know their extension. Several attempts to contact them, without any luck. Very disappointed in what was a comfortable hammock tent that should have lasted many uses.
customer_reviews.author: FireRock

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Overall im happy with this and think i got my moneys worth. The way the screen suspends is wonky and I will have to design a spreader im thinking even some points to attach a stick from the woods to keep things light. The material is thin keeping it light but as mentioned could easily be bitten through by mosquitos. The quaity is on par with the other 4 hammocks i own. The entire "System" is large and has no advantage weight wise compared to my backpacking tent. Again oveall im Happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: George Kleczka

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: great product all around! delivered in 2 days in very nice packaging! instructions were extremely clear and it only took minutes to set it up. the hammock is extremely durable and can hold hundreds of pounds easily. the design of the hammock is great too (you can even store your phone in the pocket pouch).
customer_reviews.author: Justin Woo

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying our new hammock
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered two of these lightweight hammocks for my daughters as they hike part of the AT this summer. These hammocks arrived a couple of days ago and we've tried them out already. They are lightweight, comfortable, and easy to use. The hammocks don't come with instructions, but a quick search on YouTube showed me everything I needed to know to set them up. Also, I had a question about one of the straps and they have been tremendously responsive and helpful. I'll update with more information after they get back from their trip, but based on first impressions, I highly recommend this. Lighter AND more affordable than the more expensive hammocks from other vendors.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Morford

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, netting arrived ripped
customer_reviews.text: I took this out on its first backpacking trip and was dismayed to find the mosquito netting ripped when I first took the hammock out of its bag. After a single night of use, one of the straps already started fraying. I made it last the three nights of my trip but have no confidence that will make it for another trip. It was at least comfortable to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: James S

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective good product
customer_reviews.text: Just finished the PA Grand Cannon West Rim Trail with this hammock. Overall for the money the product was great. Straps are perfectly fine. I hiked with others who had much more expensive hammocks and the straps all worked similar. In fact the simplicity of these straps I think makes them more versatile. Hammock itself is good. The tarp seems a little cheap looking however it kept me dry in a massive thunders storm. I will upgrade the stacks and ropes that came with the set. Overall very good purchase for the cost. Held up great for our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B. Montich

customer_reviews.title: I think I like camping now!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it in the backyard so far but love it. I was pleasantly surprised that I can comfortably sleep on my back or side in it. I put a small quilt on the bottom and a sleeping bag on top of that. Plenty of room- I am 5’2” 128lbs. My first hammock tent and I had to get used to the feeling of being “swaddled” but find it super comfy. I would purchase again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Lara S.

customer_reviews.title: The hammock itself is great. The bug net easy to sting up
customer_reviews.text: The hammock itself is great. The bug net easy to sting up. The rain fly doesn't have attachments at the corners and the stakes are cheap. The tree straps also are cheap. I ended up buying a different rain fly and daisy chain straps. I recommend buying the parts separately. Even though it's nice how everything is bundled, everything here but the hammock is sub par. It's all adequate for occasional camping but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Stockton350

customer_reviews.title: Not strong.  For kids
customer_reviews.text: Not for anyone over 200 lbs. I’m 195 and it ripped the ends right off the hammock. They say it holds more weight then I am but clearly won’t.
customer_reviews.author: robert gordon

customer_reviews.title: Product lacks durability
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this hammock for a month, and was finally able to try it out..I set it up and as soon as I played in the hammock a small whole had formed. So as I got out of it, it turned it to a very large hole. This should not have happened given I only weigh 190lbs. Disappointed in the quality/durability of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for his birthday. He wanted a hammock that he could potentially camp out in if he'd like, or just lounge around out in the backyard in. He is very please with the straps it came with and how easy it was to put up. The mosquito net is tricky to get in the right position to where it wasn't sagging down, touching his face while he laid in it, but a little adjustment took care of it. Great price for what is included with the hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for a new hammock camper
customer_reviews.text: This was my first hammock tent, and I'd say it is perfect to start out on. A single set of guy lines keeps the net up, a simple but effective strap set keeps the hammock up, and the rainfly is large enough to adapt to almost any setup. Sleeping in a hammock tent for the first time feels weird, but it is much better than a small tent. Light, easy, and fun. Product seems of good quality, taken it camping twice and zero problems. Comes with everything you need. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Whetstone

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed and embarrassed....
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this hammock about a month or so ago, pretty excited about using it while working at a summer camp. I was so happy about the combo of stuff, yet I guess not all that shines is gold. I used it 3 times, and the 3rd times it snapped sending me butt first into the floor, and head first into being the joke of everyone around me. I guess they made a mistake when they said the weight limit was 350, cause it clearly couldn't take my weight. Don't get fooled by the good deal, this hammock is pure crap.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel A. Lezcano

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this hammock
customer_reviews.text: Just got done with a 3 day, 2 night backpacking trip and this hammock did the job well. I did not use the rain fly because it wasn't necessary but the mosquito net worked perfectly. No durability problems with the net or the hammock. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointing. While trying to set this up with my son our camping trip we noticed the tree straps were looped through the tenssioner wrong. They would just slide through every time we tried to hang the hammock. After finally figuring it out, we re-looped them the correct way. We then noticed a tear by the loop that holds the bug net up. Also some stitching on the zipper was fraying already. This is right out of the bag, 1st time using it. The directions are not the best either.
customer_reviews.author: Casey V.

customer_reviews.title: awesome for camping
customer_reviews.text: The first time I took this out, I had the most comfortable night of camping I've ever had. It was sturdy, easy to hang, came with everything I needed to setup. I'm taking it for some cold weather camping next month, we'll see how it handles heavy winter gear.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for my needs. Only issue is lack of directions for the rain tarp, but it was dry so no need for it. I watched some YouTube vids on setup and overall was easy to have up. It was comfy and did the job. I recommend for beginners if they're looking into getting into hammock camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: All items were not included
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for a friend and it is missing the tree straps :-/ We love the hammock with the built-in bug net, the rain fly is thick. But we cannot enjoy our hammocks together because the tree straps were not in the bag. We live in Ukraine so it’s not like I can just have amazon ship me the straps. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, quality company
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery, used it immediately for two nights in the woods. Setting up and using it was simple and painless, thanks to the instructions that came with it. I was concerned with the quality of sleep and bug protection, but it was probably a better sleep than my own bed. My friends during my trip slept on the ground, I swung in the breeze. I had a question about the maintenance of the product and the company was quick to respond and incredibly helpful. I'm picking up more of their products and building myself a better camping kit with them. Will recommend to others for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to a better stake kit and maybe some better hooks for it! It’ll be worth it in the long run
customer_reviews.text: Comes in a small carrying case that isn’t heavy at all which I like! It wasn’t too bad on comfort actually, I really enjoyed it. Family and I went backpacking on a 10mile hike and I used this when we went. I read in other comments about people getting better hooks, and stakes which I would also recommend. I bent my stakes with a few hits with a rock to get them in the ground. Strapping it to a tree and setup was actually easier then I thought. All in all this is a very good and reliable hammock for the price
customer_reviews.author: derik frederiksen

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my son (11yo) to take to scout camp. It ripped on one of the seams on the first nights
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Blomgren

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this is the attachment points make the hammock ends narrow but my need for a compact package (moto-camping) made this ideal for carrying in the saddlebags. Despite some initial confusion, on my part, with the attachment points, setup and tear-down time was very fast. Used this during a 50deg (F) trip and with additional items it was very comfortable. I would not suggest using this during temps much colder without significant extras. material seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good quality of product and packaging and everything you need for hammock use is included.
customer_reviews.text: This hammock was sized well (i'm about 5'9" and felt quit strong. I enjoyed the mosquito net but did experience several bites through a night of use. The bites weren't from mosquitoes inside the hammock, rather from the underneath, where my skin was in contact with. Those things bit me through the material. I'm still happy with the purchase and realize a thicker product or tighter weave might be the only way for the hammock to fully prevent bites. I also could have used more repellent. I would still recommend this to a hiker, camper, biker, or even just someone looking for a way to comfortably nap between two posts or trees.
customer_reviews.author: Zaman Agha

customer_reviews.title: Lucky I bought better ones. Other that that good hammock wish I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this 3 stars 1st off the little loop on the bug net ripped off. Second the bag to pack away the hammock ripped off. The straps it came with stink. Lucky I bought better ones. Other that that good hammock wish I didn't get the bug net bc now I'll have to cut it off unless I can some how patch it in a way.
customer_reviews.author: Frankep

customer_reviews.title: Good Value - Quality Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-featured little package for the price. I've slept comfortably in it many times now. There are some concerns though. The stitching throughout it not great. I'm already loosing a significant amount of stitching on the upper grosgrain support for the bugnet and there are loose threads from both the hammock material and the stitching all over on the inside on the hem where the zipper is attached. Also, the hammock is a bit stretchy. I'm always hanging a bit lower by morning than when I set it up the night before (135lbs.). I now just hang it a little tighter knowing it will sag by morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product with all the pieces needed!
customer_reviews.text: Great hammock with all the pieces!!! The only thing that is difficult as you can see is that this was bought for my 10 year old and he isn’t tall enough to get the elastic ropes higher up the tree to pull the mosquito net higher above his face. All in all a great product, he loves it, mission accomplished. This is the first time he set it up when we went camping as a family. He will be using it for Boy Scouts when they go camping also. Great investment, great product and he will get plenty of use from it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Rollman

customer_reviews.title: Good product especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great product. I am taking my first backpacking trip and after figuring out I sleep best in a hammock I didn’t want to spend a large sum of money but also wanted a good product. I spent 4 days sleeping in this set up and slept like a dream. Added an underquilt to keep the chill off me but easy set up tear down and overall really liked the product. Can’t go wrong for the price
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Ann Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Has everything you need
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Comes with hammock, bug net(attached), and a rain fly. Quality is really good for the price and I had no trouble at all with set up or anything. IF it is the first time you're setting up, look up a guide or video on how to connect it to the tree because no instructions came with mine. I figured it out without too much trouble. Good luck and have fun!
customer_reviews.author: steven jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammock
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hammock several times to camp. I put a mat in the bottom and it's very comfortable. Seams and straps have held up well with no issues. The mosquito net is a nice add for camping in the south.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Penton

customer_reviews.title: Good price and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good price and good quality. I didn't use the strap that came with the hammock because they felt not strong enough. But everything else work perfectly. I will recommended for someone looking for a good inexpensive hammock.
customer_reviews.author: juan

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price. Great entry level hammock.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hammock twice. So far it has held up and provided me with great sleep. The rain fly has also kept me dry and warm as it started pouring rain during one of my trips. The only suggestion I would make is I replaced the straps with ENO slap straps. This makes it a lot easier to adjust and set up. This is a great entry level hammock and I would suggest this hammock to a beginner camper or someone who wants to try hammock camping. Eventually you will want to upgrade to another hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Blackkatz

customer_reviews.title: Yes please!
customer_reviews.text: Ive never hammocked before, but my goodness what a treat! 5 day camping trip and this made the trip a dream! Absolutely worth every penny spent! It has everything you need to have a great nights rest!
customer_reviews.author: Elicia

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I unfortunately fell on the ground once but that was due to the rope I used to tie it to the tree, once I replaced it with paracord it held up great all night, very comfortable and it rained all night long and I didn’t get a single drip on me nor did I get a single bug in it. Best sleep I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good Hammock. Slept in it for 2 weeks in ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Hammock. Slept in it for 2 weeks in central America. Be careful setting up the mosquito netting. I tore mine the 1st time I set it up. Had to repair with a needle and thread. I don't think I will ever sleep on the ground in a tent again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trekking the Everglades
customer_reviews.text: Was great. Easy set up. Not even the noseums got in. Stayed comfortable all night. Got excellent air flow. About 5 minutes to set up. And about 5 minutes to pack. Attacked stuff sack for main platform was a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Screen was ripped when arrived and ripped more when used
customer_reviews.text: Cheap construction, ripped on first use. Was used only once and now screen is useless!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the night let down.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a backpacking trip. Spent one night in the backyard and it was great. Tree straps are really good. Bug net came with elastic cords which is nice. Rain fly seems adequate but I didn’t use it. First night backpacking the hammock tore in the middle, right under my butt. Spent that night sleeping on top of the rain fly folded up on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Really solid gear without paying premium price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son doing a long hike. Worked great only ding is weakness in design for how the net assembles with hammock, if they would make it more integrated to aid the setup then it would be 5 stars. Still a real good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: I waited till I took it for a spin and it’s a good hammock especially because it’s all in one I will def make a couple of modifications on the tree straps because I had to tie them but other then that it survived 3 rugged days in Maine kept the bugs and rain out and I’m very pleased worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Sean flynn

customer_reviews.title: Survived heavy rain!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our son’s 15th birthday. We had terrible rain on the second night of our trip, he stayed perfectly dry in his hammock tent. I wish we could say the same about the tent my husband and I slept in. I was a little worried about the low cost of this, but it was definitely a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: kate08

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value!
customer_reviews.text: There isn't another camping hammock with this level of value. Mosquito netting and a rain fly along with tree straps in one package. A very very good if you are over 6 ft. You may wish to consider a larger hammock.
customer_reviews.author: BlackStar

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Comfortable. Well done.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good ! And it’s super comfortable. I have a destroyed back from being in the service but this thing solo with no pad for two nights was a cake walk. Love the bug net setup and it works. Not a single critter joined me for a sleepover lol. Rain fly was not needed but set up anyway and seems to cover enough area for any gear you would need to store under your hammock should it rain on you. Set up wasn’t to bad.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great set that works well for me. I purchased this set for a multi-day motorcycle trip and it did not disappoint. The integrated bug net is great and kept me from getting eaten alive. Setup is a breeze and I felt comfortable after one practice in the yard. I'm 6'0", 210 lbs and had plenty of room to get into a good diagonal lay in the hammock. The tarp is huge and you are able to set it up in several different configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Adler

customer_reviews.title: Good Hammock and Great Value
customer_reviews.text: A great hammock. It just plain works and is an excellent value. I used is for a week at a Boy Scout summer camp and could not be happier. It stayed dry in the rain (tropical downpours) and kept me bug free and comfortable at night.
customer_reviews.author: MKH

customer_reviews.title: It's a bargain
customer_reviews.text: It worked as described. I would definitely recommend buying a hammock sleeping pad to fit inside the hammock to add some comfort and protection from the outside of the hammock. Cold/heat penetrate the hammock body very easily which can cause some comfort issues even inside a sleeping bag. The big thing is I had to flip the main stap adjustment clips. Before I flipped them, the strap would slip and hammock would lose tension. Afterwards, it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Glen S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I hung this in my yard a few times to practice and I loved it. This weekend I took it on its first camping trip and it was awesome! Easy to put up & take down, extremely comfortable, and the price was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammock
customer_reviews.text: My son is a boy scout and several of the boys in his troop have hammocks, which they sleep in instead of tents when camping. Two of my son's friends have Oak Creek hammocks and my son liked these hammocks the best. So, we bought him his own. He has only had a chance to sleep in it one night so far but he said he really likes it. This is a great kit that includes both a built in mosquito net and a rain fly. Other hammocks I looked out sold mosquito nets and rain flys separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality system
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a couple of months ago and my husband loves it. The cinch buckle strap system is better than the loop system from his previous system.
customer_reviews.author: T. Stockon

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to set up, not sure how to rate the comfort , only used it twice, only down size was the tree straps I may replace them
customer_reviews.author: D Standiford

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners or someone on a budget. You won't find a better deal than this one!
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price on this hammock. It really is a great hammock too, a little on the heavy side but it is excellent for a beginner or any one on a budget. Im only giving four stars because my only complaint about this product is the mosquito netting tore where the tie rope is sewed in. I found that a little bungie cord tied on the net side helps keep it from having some much pull on the netting.
customer_reviews.author: KP Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: Netting didn't have all the loops to hold it up properly. Good thing I know how to make it work with some strap and sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: First experience hammcok camping! GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: First time setting it up was a learning experience. It takes a second to figure out but still very self explanatory. Slept overnight in a storm and stayed nice and dry and big free with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: No mosquito bites & Dryness guaranteed
customer_reviews.text: First Time camping using only the essentials that are in the bundle above and it was seriously the best last minute purchase ever. I did experience a rain storm while using it and I was safe and dry through both days.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you don't sit on the bug net. lol
customer_reviews.text: Recieved the hammock and camped four days and nights over the 4th of July weekend. Very comfortable. Best sleep ever while camping. Love that everything needed is included. Rained every day and one night. Stayed dry as a bone. I sat on the bug net one night and popped one of the attachments. Duct taped it at the time. Suppose I'll try sewing it now. Not a complaint. Was my fault. Highly recommend this package!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Jones

customer_reviews.title: It works for the bundle. Skinny people only.
customer_reviews.text: So if your skinny this is fine. The tree straps that this comes with a pretty weird to use. Could use some better instructions on how to use the straps. We own 2 other portable hammocks. Both other straps are pretty easy to figure out. This one, well it works holds all 265lbs of me but give yourself extra time the first time to figure them out.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Vanweerthuizen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: All around good. Set it up and did a three day camp with it. It rained the first day and the rain fly worked great. I recommend a sleeping bag or sleeping pad so mosquitos can't get ya through the bottom. Just because it's that this doesn't mean anything though. Mosquitos can get you through jeans. Loved it just wish there was a dark green color or something less bright.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the price, didn't expect it to be as nice as it is! My order was missing a carabiner but the company far exceeded my expectations to rectify the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Emir H.

customer_reviews.title: Great starter hammock
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hammock for backpacking and it's great. It's very affordable and I got it to see if I preferred this to tent camping. I'm now a hammock convert.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Hand

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to sleep in!
customer_reviews.text: I use this hammock for sleeping in while camping, and it's pretty comfortable. The rain sheet is great, and the mosquito net is a plus. You need a mosquito net if you are hammock camping. It's simple to set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bernett

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy for my kids to setup on their own. They found it quite cozy. The tree friendly straps were easy to secure.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Use different straps
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great except the straps. We prefer our gorilla straps as they are easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Product testing lover

customer_reviews.title: Great hammock for the $$
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit bulky and probably not suited for a serious backpacker or anything, but for my teenager it makes a great camping hammock.,
customer_reviews.author: PMR

customer_reviews.title: Great for Boy Scouts
customer_reviews.text: Great hammock for kids. Not quite big enough for larger adults. Greats for Boy Scouts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good experience
customer_reviews.text: Very good. I’ve camped two nights in different terrains with this. Very durable and comfortable. Do pack something for comfort as it gets cold even on warm nights. I found the experience very different from all my years of rent camping. But this hammock is my go-to way to camp now. So light and easy to pack...be sure to try it in the backyard before taking it into the wild.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: woahh!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: im 250 lbs and it can carry my weight!!! i was so scared at first but it actually is really durable!
customer_reviews.author: Flexintoes

customer_reviews.title: Test before a trip.
customer_reviews.text: I like the packability of this product...I purchased two, the second one a few months after the first purchase. Took them both on a 7 night trip into the BWCA. The straps on the second purchased hammock would not lock and bind in any way other than tying them off. This was odd because the first hammock never gave me any issues. They appear to be the same design.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set up for hiking. The fly and netting systems take a little tweaking to make it comfortable Good value for the money just takes longer to set up and take down
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This hammock does everything you’d expect it to do. It’s easy to set up only takes a few mins. Is made of good quality materials and is really comfortable to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Viper34L

customer_reviews.title: Good value--our first hammock
customer_reviews.text: 14-year-old son took this to High Adventure scout camp and he is now a HAMMOCK sleeper for life! Packs small, light, and appreciated the attached bug net. We do not have anything to compare it to for quality and have only had it for a month so can't tell yet how well it will wear. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Comes with everything you need, did great on its first trip! Comfy and I’m really impressed with the quality and how much you get for the price
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Younger

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, holds enough wt, my husband 280lbs and my daughter 59 lbs. Both slept comfortable. It rained and they were kept dry. Must have....
customer_reviews.author: Veatriz

customer_reviews.title: Best hammock I've found for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this thing four times now. It's so easy to setup even in the dark. Also, I weigh 230lbs and this thing holds me up nice and secure even when I'm fidgeting around inside.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Barbuto

customer_reviews.title: Why not!
customer_reviews.text: For the money why not! Everything in a affordable package this is my first hammock and I can’t wait to put it to use
customer_reviews.author: Levi R.

customer_reviews.title: Mosquitoes will eat you right through the Hammock
customer_reviews.text: The side that you will be laying on is super thin. Mosquitos will eat the ever loving heck out of your back and neck. I got home and thought I payed on a spiders nest all weekend. Also, if there is a slight breeze while you are sleeping you will feel it. The wind blows right through the hammock. Claustrophobics be aware. This can get a little uncomfortable if you are afraid of tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great set up. Too small for me at 6’10” so I’m going with an 11’ hammock but this will be my back up or my wife’s or kids can use it. Well made. Easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: JohnERed66

customer_reviews.title: Okay hammock, good fly, bad straps
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay hammock. Not really much different than the lesser expensive models. However, the rainfly is much better than other lesser expensive models. I couldn't make sense of how to best use the straps around the trees.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials
customer_reviews.text: First purchase on a camping hammock, easy to set up and just as easy to pack up, definitely recommend this set up for anyone wanting to get back to basics!
customer_reviews.author: James Crook

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Had it on a few overnights already super easy to set up and adjust straps that comes with are pretty high quality they don't slip or stretch built-in bug net is a must and everything actually folds back up until the stuff bags easy would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Deshawn

customer_reviews.title: Great for young campers!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my grandson who is a boy scout. He loves it. It was so easy for him that i also ordered one for my younger grandson.
customer_reviews.author: kat t

customer_reviews.title: Good Hammock, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This hammock shows up as described and was easy to set up. Kept me bug-free and dry through three nights of camping in a wide range of weather situations.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A George

customer_reviews.title: How do you use these straps ... 12 youtube videos later
customer_reviews.text: There definitely needs to be some instructions for the use of the hammock straps for people who are new to hammock camping. The straps are not intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Fr Bede Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Great company with good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Decent hammocks the kids love them going to try them out in the bwca this weekend. Made under quilts and sleeves for both the hammocks and the rain flys. One of the hammocks showed up with a small tare in the bug netting. The customer service was excellent and the seller took care of the problem quickly with no hassle at all. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JERRY OLSON

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to weight rating and if you can fit.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a decent starter hammock for average size person. However, it says up to 350 lbs. I’m 265 and this thing had be bound up like a very tightly rolled burrito with no room for movement. Very uncomfortable for anyone of any size. If you’re over 200 I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ownby

customer_reviews.title: It was extremely comfortable and helped keep the swelling down in my legs ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this hammock when I backpacked part of the Appalachian trail. It was extremely comfortable and helped keep the swelling down in my legs since they were elevated. The rain fly helped keep in heat and the mosquito net kept out any unwanted bugs. Super easy to set up. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: I would bought  an extra line to keep the rain fly off the the bug net.
customer_reviews.text: First time ever owning a hammock and loved it. Took it to Shenandoah National park with my buddy for a weekend get away and it worked extremely well. This is the set up in my backyard. Slept like a baby it was so comfortable. First night I slept in the hammock it rained super hard and was very dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great deal! The hammock was easy to set up, and great to have a mesh bug net over it for sleeping under the stars. The rain fly was quick and easy to setup when we had an unexpected shower too.
customer_reviews.author: Christy C.

customer_reviews.title: Interesting hammock
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, It needs some refinement. The tiedowns for the rain fly are not very good. it's bulky so it wouldn't make a very good hiking hammock
customer_reviews.author: Davecrawfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Good set for the price! Everything you need even if some parts could be a lil better like the stakes or minor things. All the major components are great and the hammock is very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Boatner

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Have used this hammock while camping and hiking and love it. Wish the tree straps were longer but managed to make it work. Survived a few cold nights and even a couple rains. Make sure to take some paracord for drip lines.
customer_reviews.author: Chris T.

customer_reviews.title: Great starter hammock
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a cheap option for hammock camping this is a great option. It’s comfy, not heavy, and works pretty great I’ve had it on several overnight trips and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: River S.

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: There is holes where the mosquito net hooks are. For something I just got in the mail, that shouldn't be the case.
customer_reviews.author: breannaheiman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hammock for my 13 yr old son because he was going on a hiking trip. He loved it! Was able to hang easily with his cousin and kept the bugs off him at night and dry when it rained. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: James Field

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty heavy. Comes with every you need it bad. Quick takedown. Took a wile to figure out the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: Like it, used it, lived up to the description, very satisfied indeed!!
customer_reviews.author: The Marion's

product_meta.title: Lost Valley Camping Hammock | Bundle Includes Mosquito Net, Rain Fly, Tree Straps, & Compression Sack | Weighs Only 4 Pounds, Perfect for Hammock Camping | Lightweight Nylon Portable Single Hammock
feature_bullets: The Original Camping Hammock Bundle Includes Single Hammock, Rain Fly, Mosquito Net, 2 Tree straps, 2 12kN Aluminum Carabiners, 2 Stakes, and 2 Guy Lines
Ultra Strong, Tear Resistant Parachute Nylon Material With Reinforced Stitching and Knotting That Holds Up To 350 lbs
Hammock Includes an Accessory Pouch on the Inside for Your Smart Phone
All Components fit into a Drawstring Bag and Weigh Less Than 4 Pounds
Hammock Set is Portable, Lightweight, and Sets Up In 3 Minutes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars549 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
